author: {'steamid': '76561198040649685', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1470407388}
review:
The Tribe is a game with good art, though maybe a odd split between either high higher resolutions and pixel art that makes me wonder what it's trying to go for.  And decent music, though it's a bit repetetive.  With a simple gameplay premise of a runner, a genre done to death and free to play on any modern phone.  It definately all works well, but if it does then why am I not reccomending this?

Well plain and simple; balancing.  "What do you mean?" I hear you asking!  Well I start a new game, and within at most ten seconds my whole tribe is already starving with no option of food, the first chance I get is CANABALISM.  And I have to wait for that due to a recent update, so I starve to resort to canabalism, then I am given a level lower than required to canabalise again, then guess what?  IM ALREADY STARVING AGAIN!  You can literally start a game and die before you can get any food (other than canabalising).  And for that reason I feel like it's not a "tactical" game (as the store page describes it) but more of a rouge-lite get lucky or die trying game.

Now this issue is easy to get around.  And I'll say multiple ways for it to be remedied.
1. Make the abillity to eat someone, available from the start.
2. Start the Shaman at a higher level so everythings available untill you die.
3. Allow saves / multiple saves.  This might make it less "hardcore" but really this can fix it in a way, you only have to get lucky once then you can start from there whenever.  Multiple saves in general is just an improvement.

Something that's absolutely unacceptable though is the lack of ANY options.  Unless you count muting or unmuting ALL SOUNDS or swapping between English and Russian.  Seriously, no in game sliders, or a selection between music and sound effects.  No capping framerates, or rather uncapping them, no resolution, no windowed select.  NOTHING. 

There's also the problem of it getting repetitive, really really quickly, but that's more of a genre problem; after all there's only so many ways you can make us split.

For five dollars though it's such a little expense, what I am worried about is for when it raises price.  "Yes, the game's price will rise once the game is complete."  If its over seven, I'm guessing ten is what they'll go for, I'd declare it not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079895426', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1470418572}
review:
I am LOVING the art style and different spin and the runner genre but I REALLY need to be able to divide the tribe in a correct manner... It is impossible to divide in four to pass four bridges and come out of it without losing most of your tribe... This is pretty sad :(

Despite that... The game is AMAZING and engaging, giving the runner genre a GREAT new adition! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198004400284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1515888455}
review:
I played this game during its beta cycle and I have to say that I am thoroughly impressed to the additions.  Think organ trail meets the Croods.  The game mechanics are simple but has you stay on your toes through the gameplay.  It is difficult, but difficulty can be managed with a little luck.  I absolutely love the pixilation and the story moments during each resting period.
Similar to organ trail, the game has a lot of replay value, especially due to the random encounters added with the random story elements.

review: Pretty interesting conception: procedural runner plus text quests. Easy going gameplay. But your tribe will die fast until you get how works all gameplay layers. Yep, this is not just a runner. Everyone sick about another fp2 endless and meaningless runners. But this is not a runner in common sense. Think about it as a puzzle game. Maybe it will help you to survive more than couple runs. Good luck! And don't forget to feed your tribesman.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985100244', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1509108337}
review: I just played a little, but that was fun. Guys, I never seen tutorial like this. Like, basic things like do this, do that, EAT YOUR BROTHER, go left. It also remembers these hardcore games like Super Hexagon, those ones when you have to try hard. Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198266608571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1472239210}
review:
I've been waiting for this game for a very long time. The longer you wait, the higher your expectations are. So now it's time to declare, that I'm not a bit disappointed. The game is just brilliant!
The art is a pure eye candy and the gameplay is addicting as hell!
The controls are pretty unusual, (in a few words, you split and gather your running tribe with a mouse to grab stuff or to avoid traps), but it takes less than a minute to catch the trick.
The game is full of funny details and challenging mechanics, which it won't spoonfeed to you in order not to spoil your pleasure of figuring out yourself how to eat, hunt, fight, avoid traps etc.
Early access makes me hope, that the game will be even better. But even now it's definitely worth it's cost already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047847143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1469909682}
review:
https://youtu.be/MoTPUXkOv0w

I found this game quite fun. I like runners - this one has a great twist to avoid, kill, and overcome enemies or obsticals. I like the different tokens you get based on what you do in the run, which then directly relates to how you talk to people during events or what you do at night. Making huge decisions at night based on the food you have collected or the things happening around you adds a lot to the game and to the role of Shaman. The map of different areas is also well laid out and nice to look at. This game has a good feel and is fun to play overall!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003711145', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1514471308}
review: I was waiting for this game for a year and it's totally worth it. High detailed art, interesting interpretation of runner mechanics, atmospheric prehistoric setting. For that price you should definetely try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112306095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1469790032}
review:
Overall impression.
I feel like I fall inside a Quest for Fire novel. Very solid immersion inside Neolithic-Iron Age. I feel their hunger. I feel their thirst. I feel their desire.

About gameplay.
It's definitely a runner of new kind, without turns and jumps but with a game in positioning parts of a tribe. It's better to have a fast mind and fast hands to success in the game. Core gameplay is build around positioning of groups of people around the map and picking right tools in a right moment. You should be ready to be a hard hearted person. It is necessary to sacrifice a part of the tribe in a right moment in order to survive. But you always can invite new people to joint the tribe as soon as you have enough food.
Look for food, avoid predators, eliminate smaller tribes, survive, run! Run people, Run!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039422334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1469779401}
review:
Cozy neat visuals and funny gameplay! A bit too hard for a runner, sometimes I don't really understand what's happening. Fed some fishes with half of the tribe in a first level - got the "Mass Bathing" achievement - funny as hell!:)

The cool part - giving your guys some spears and torches and let them pick berries. Don't get ther sacrifice part so far, but getting along without magic quite well to be honest.

To sum up, quite a fun, hopefully the devs will get more stuff and modes in release version, especially endless mode: I want a lot LOT LOTS of people and kill pterodactyls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172324801', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1469778634}
review:
I was really looking forward to playing this game, and for the first 45 minutes it was fun. But it gets really repetitive quite fast as it's always the game enemies (understandable), and you have to go through this chat dialogue everytime you past the round, sometimes having a quest kind of thing (wish I found annoying to read as of the way it's worded). And once you past the first game, you move onto the real thing in which you have 50 days to complete (didn't say what the 50 days was four) so you end up repeating the same thing over and over and over to finish those 50 days. 

This is more of an opinion, as I don't normally write reviews and don't know how to do them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984953417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1474738872}
review: Really nice pixel game with amazing atmosphere. Simple controls, interesting gameplay and story. Definitely a must-have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198187027410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1469772749}
review:
Shaman knows his ways ) 
This game is awesome! You will be clicking your way out of the deadly rhinos and sabertooth tigers, desperately trying to find some food so you don't need to eat your own tribemates, and escape the frequent bridges across the rivers (also deadly). And when your tribe safely stops for a nighttime, there are intricate text encounters waiting for you. 

Some minor bugs are to be expected (EA), but all in all the game is primal fun. 10 cannibals from 10.
